1.text_: Built to protect mankind, two androids fight the machines.:<TAP>
\n\nThe female is 2B: A powerful warrior who fights on the front line.:<TAP>
\nThe male is 9S: A support unit who aids 2B from afar.:<TAP>
\nWhen they fight as one, nothing can stop them.:<PAGE>
But 9S has a secret::<TAP>
\nHe wants to free 2B from her world of unending war.:<PAGE>
One day, as they pursue yet another enemy, they find themselves\nmaking their way through a massive limestone cavern.:<TAP>
\nFoes attack them and fall, one after the other.:<PAGE>
The machines stand no chance against them.:<PAGE>
They proceed deep into the cavern, then deeper still.:<PAGE>
Finally, they reach their destination.\nThe darkness is absolute.:<PAGE>
But the moment they step forward, they are enveloped\nin a brilliant red light.:<TAP>
\nOnly then does 9S realize his mistake.:<PAGE>
The enemy has been using electronic camouflage.:<TAP>
\nThere are machine lifeforms here—dozens of them.:
\nSuddenly, 2B emits a heartrending scream.:<PAGE>
She is infected with a virus—a weapon designed\nto destroy an android from the inside out.:<TAP>
\nHer eyes begin to glow red.:<PAGE>
It is a worst-case scenario, and 9S knows the best thing\nfor him to do is abandon the fight and retreat.:<TAP>
\nBut he refuses to even consider this option.:<PAGE>
He will save 2B. He must.:
<align=right>For that is his purpose in life.:<TAP>

<align=center>In a desperate maneuver, he links himself to her infected mind
and begins diving into its deepest, most hidden parts.:<PAGE>
2B's mind is a maze—a labyrinth.:<TAP>
\nFinally, he throws open a door and beholds a strange sight::<PAGE>
Flickering memories of himself, all from the perspective of 2B.:<PAGE>
He sees himself in a forest of metal.\nA frozen ocean. A boiling desert.:<TAP>
\nBut he remembers none of this.:<PAGE>
And all the memories end in exactly the same way::<TAP>
\nWith 2B killing him.:<PAGE>
She does so over. And over. And over.:<PAGE>
And over. And over. And over.:
But for each death, there is also a first meeting.:<PAGE>
Each time, he says, \n"People who know me well usually call me Nines.":<PAGE>
He says this dozens of times. Hundreds.:
In another part of 2B's mind, 9S locates the virus and disables it.:<TAP>
\nThe enemy stumbles in response to the unexpected counterattack,\nand the two take advantage of the situation to escape.:<PAGE>
Later, 2B reports the completion of their mission.:<TAP>
\nAs 9S lends his damaged companion a shoulder, he thinks::<TAP>
Why does 2B kill me? Why are my memories erased? And why do we always meet again?:
The answer eludes him, and he cannot find the words to ask.:<TAP>
\n\nHowever...:<PAGE>
So long as he remains in her mind...:<PAGE>
<align=center>So long as a part of him is in her memory...:<PAGE>
<align=left>He doesn't care how many times she kills him.:<PAGE>
Their fate is a never-ending spiral, and they cling to its threads.:<PAGE>
So 9S walks on through the darkness.:<PAGE>
The boy stirs to wakefulness in an unfamiliar room.:<TAP>
\n\nBeside him sits a silent clockwork man and a woman with a gentle smile.:<PAGE>
The boy had traveled countless unforgiving lands in an attempt to halt the cruel war staged by his own kingdom.:<TAP>
\nYet he now finds himself in the comfortable bed of a civilian.:<TAP>
\n"What happened?" he asks.:<PAGE>
The man apologizes for acting on his own discretion.:<TAP>
\n\nHe explains how the woman came to their aid when the boy fell victim to a mighty seizure.:<PAGE>
As the boy begins to thank his rescuer, he silently curses the inadequacy of his frail and sickly body.:<PAGE>
But irony rules the day, and he launches into a coughing fit before he can finish speaking.:<PAGE>
The woman gently lowers the hacking boy back onto the bed.:<PAGE>
Sleep comes to claim him once more.:<TAP>
\n\nPerhaps this is because illness has worn him to the bone, or perhaps it is due to the radiant warmth of her hands.:<PAGE>
As he drifts away, he takes a moment to appreciate the brief moment of respite.:<PAGE>
Several days have passed since the boy began his treatment in the woman's humble abode.:<TAP>
\n\nHe occasionally hears commotion erupt outside.:<TAP>
\nThe townsfolk talk of nothing save the war.:<PAGE>
The fires of battle spread daily across the land, and they fear their town will soon be set to burn.:<TAP>
\n\nEventually, their unease grows so great that a guard is dispatched to keep watch over the boy and man.:<PAGE>
I have to form my alliance as quickly as possible, thinks the boy. I must forge a peace among these warring nations.:
\n\nDespite the boy's conviction, his weakened body fights him at every turn.:<PAGE>
Instead of helping the people, he finds himself increasingly reliant on their aid.:<TAP>
\nThe pain of his fever and cough is soon joined by the endless throb of a guilty conscience.:<PAGE>
The woman tends him briskly and efficiently.:<TAP>
\n\nDespite the raging war, her words are soft and kind.:<TAP>
\nDespite her abject poverty, her food is warm and hearty.:<PAGE>
The situation begins to remind the boy of his childhood.:<TAP>
\nAs his thoughts spin, they finally alight on a particular memory::<PAGE>
One from his earliest days as a child.:<TAP>
\nIt is the face of his mother—a woman who departed this world long, long ago.:<PAGE>
Slowly but surely, the boy progresses in his recovery.:<PAGE>
One day, a thought occurs to him::<TAP>
\n\nWhy is this woman working so hard for me?:
\nAnd why does she remind me of my mother?:
The boy asks his clockwork companion if he knows anything of her circumstances.:<TAP>
\nThe man nods and reaches for a nearby picture frame that is turned face-down.:<TAP>
\n\nHe flips it over to reveal a family photograph.:<PAGE>
The man then begins to speak of the room's history.:<TAP>
\nThis country keeps a database of all citizens, one he had been able to access.:<PAGE>
He continues speaking, his voice dry and emotionless.:<TAP>
\nHe tells the boy what he found in the records of the woman's family.:<TAP>
\nThe room in which they rest once belonged to her child.:<PAGE>
The same child who smiles so brightly in the photo.:<TAP>
\n\nBut the fires of war had claimed him some time ago.:<PAGE>
And just as the boy sensed his late mother in the woman, so too did she sense her late child in him.:<PAGE>
A time of respite.:<TAP>
\nA woman's devotion.:<PAGE>
A veiled love.:<TAP>
\n\nPain shoots through the boy's heart.:<TAP>
\n\nBut it does not come from his illness.:<PAGE>
Instead, it comes from a realization.:<TAP>
\nA realization that his own homeland is responsible for all of this.:<PAGE>
The woman's endless devotion stems from her conflating the boy with her own dead child.:<TAP>
\nA child that was killed by the very war the boy's homeland had started.:<TAP>
\n\nThis truth lay heavily on the boy's heart.:<PAGE>
"Enough," he says to the clockwork man. "I can stay here no longer.":<TAP>
\nHe dresses himself and uses his staff to rise from the bed.:<PAGE>
As the man reaches to steady the boy, the distant rumble of cannon fire rings out.:<TAP>
\nIt is the sound of lives being lost.:<TAP>
\nThe familiar footsteps of tragedy march ever closer.:<TAP>
\n\nThey threaten to engulf the house at any moment.:<PAGE>
The woman suddenly leaps from her bed and rushes to the pair, begging them not to leave.:<TAP>
\n\n"Let me go," says the boy. "I am not your son; I am from the kingdom, and royal blood flows in my veins.":<PAGE>
Shock breaks out across the woman's face before slowly morphing into hatred.:<PAGE>
It's your fault," she growls. "Your fault.":<TAP>
\n\n"My son is dead and it's all your fault!":
\nShe lets forth an agonized howl—the pain of a mother tormented by an immutable past.:<PAGE>
"Yes," replies the boy "I am responsible.":<TAP>
\nHe bows his head deeply.:<TAP>
\nHe knows he is the target of her hatred—and he knows that it is earned.:<PAGE>
As they abandon the house, the boy's fever spikes and the pain threatens to blot out his consciousness.:<TAP>
\n\nBut he continues stumbling on.:<TAP>
\nHe will protect the woman and her house.:<TAP>
\nHe will stop the war.:<TAP>
\n\nHe will bear the burden of hate for as long as he must.:<PAGE>
That is why he walks on.:<TAP>
\n\n...And why he never looks back.:<PAGE>
These are the soldiers who battle the Flowers that threaten humanity.:<TAP>
\n\nThey are treated no better than prisoners, their every action and thought regulated and overseen as they are thrown without mercy into the maw of an endless war.:<PAGE>
One day, a pair of voices echo out from their base.:<TAP>
\n\nThey belong to a young recruit and his instructor.:<PAGE>
The recruit has made countless appeals to fight on the frontlines, but the instructor has refused him every step of the way.:<TAP>
\n\nTheir constant back-and-forth has continued without pause from the moment they met.:<PAGE>
"I will kill every last Flower, even if it means my life," cries the recruit.:<TAP>
\n\nThe boy burns with his desire to fight.:<PAGE>
He seeks revenge against the Flowers—the killers of his one true love.:<PAGE>
But rather than respond with anger of her own, the instructor gently urges him to reconsider.:<TAP>
\n\n"You need to focus on survival; you only get to die once.":<PAGE>
But such kindness reminds him of his late love, and only serves to fan the fires of vengeance in his heart.:<PAGE>
Once she sees what I'm capable of, she'll understand.:
\nThe recruit has devoted himself to training with that one thought in mind.:<TAP>
\n\nAnd though it never gained much traction with his instructor, he decides to make her a proposal::<PAGE>
"If I get top marks in our next virtual drill, you have to let me go on a mission.":<TAP>
\n\nBefore she can respond, he turns on his heel and exits the barracks.:<PAGE>
He needs to fight. He needs to avenge his love.:
\n\nHis entire will is bent upon it.:<PAGE>
The recruit's participation in battle hinges on his performance in a virtual drill.:<TAP>
\n\nWhen it is finished, he has the highest score by far.:<PAGE>
The other soldiers rush to his side, erupting with joy and claiming he holds the key to defeating their enemy.:<TAP>
\n\nAs they celebrate, the recruit turns to his instructor and regards her coldly.:<TAP>
\n\n"You have to let me fight now. You don't have a choice.":<PAGE>
As she readies herself to turn him down once more, the base commander suddenly appears.:<TAP>
\n\n"These are excellent results," says the commander. "I look forward to seeing all of you perform in the next mission.":<PAGE>
The soldiers raise a hearty cheer at his praise...:<TAP>
\nThough the officer's razor smile hints at something deeper.:<TAP>
\n\nAmidst the raucous cheering, the recruit hears his instructor whisper a single sentence::<PAGE>
"I am unable to stop them yet again...":<TAP>
\n\nBut he does not notice the meaning buried in her words.:<PAGE>
Since receiving permission to fight, the recruit has spent his every waking hour in intense training.:<TAP>
\n\nThe thought of his dead love burns in his heart as he imagines giving the Flowers the justice they so richly deserve.:<PAGE>
Finally, the day of the mission arrives.:<TAP>
\nThe squad's morale is higher than ever.:<TAP>
\n\nInspired by their fellow recruit's fighting spirit, they have all been training especially hard.:<PAGE>
As they prepare to set out, the recruit's instructor meets his gaze somberly.:<TAP>
\n\n"I know what you are capable of. Just...please don't be reckless. Please.":
The recruit responds with a chuckle, as if her worry is the silliest thing imaginable.:<TAP>
\n\n"Don't worry. I've got this.":<PAGE>
When the battle with the Flowers is over, he knows their fruitless quarrels can finally end.:<TAP>
\n\nShe will have no choice but to acknowledge his ability once she sees his skills in battle.:<PAGE>
He grips his sword tighter.:<TAP>
\n\nHis long-awaited campaign of revenge is now mere moments away...:<TAP>
The soldiers' first battle against the Flowers has begun.:<TAP>
\n\nThis recruit breaks the dam on the ocean of vengefulness in his heart, hacking through countless numbers of Flowers with his blade.:<PAGE>
When the intense battle finally comes to an end, an uneasy silence settles over the ruined city.:<PAGE>
Only one soul still draws breath.:<TAP>
\n\nIt is the instructor. She sits silently on the ground, cradling the corpse of the recruit who had fought so valiantly.:<PAGE>
The commanding officer arrives in a collection vehicle and scowls. "Another failure," he mutters.:<TAP>
\n\nThen another figure steps out from behind the officer.:<PAGE>
The eyes are a familiar, intense hue—one she has witnessed during countless arguments.:<TAP>
\nThey are identical to those of the corpse she now cradles in her arms.:<PAGE>
As the new arrival stares out at the grim battlefield, his face contorts into a sneer.:<TAP>
\n\n"I will kill every last Flower, even if it means my life," cries the recruit.:<PAGE>
How many times has it been now?:<TAP>
\n\nAs she considers what a pointless thought that is, she quietly replies to the new recruit::<PAGE>
"You need to focus on survival; you only get to die once.":<TAP>
\n\nYet her kind words are tinged by an endless echo of despair.:<PAGE>
A lone woman silently walks beside a sparkling sea where sunlight glistens on the water.:<TAP>
\nShe is elegance personified, her black swimwear giving her the appearance of a gossamer butterfly.:<PAGE>
This place is not her home. Rather, she has come here to complete a single mission.:<TAP>
\n\nShe has been tasked with slipping aboard a nearby ship and stealing a person's life.:<PAGE>
For this woman is an assassin.\nBut though this is not her home, the place is not entirely unfamiliar. She has been here once before—long, long ago.:<PAGE>
As she gazes out at the light playing over the water, she thinks back on that time.:<TAP>
\n\nShe was young then—so young—her spirit not yet worn thin by the passing of years.:<PAGE>
She journeyed to this place as part of her rigorous training, tasked with locating a corrupt politician from a rival country.:<PAGE>
Then, as now, the port was a lively place, with ships from around the world moving in and out on a regular basis.:<TAP>
\nIt was a city filled with all manner and races of people, and no one paid any mind to the innocent girl who walked among their number.:<PAGE>
This was exactly how she wanted it; the more they overlooked her, the easier it would be to gain the information she sought.:<TAP>
\nAfter a bit, she learned her target would soon be attending a political gathering aboard a ship.:<TAP>
\n\nBut she did not know the identity of the ship, and their number was legion.:<PAGE>
If she were to sneak aboard the wrong one, all of her careful planning would be for naught. But as the girl pondered this dilemma...:<PAGE>
A shock raced through her body.:<PAGE>
Focused as she had been on the ships, she did not notice the young boy running along the pier and had smashed straight into him.:<PAGE>
The girl on a mission collided with a young boy along the water's edge.:<PAGE>
Though clad in fine clothing, he raised his voice in a most undignified howl as he lay upon the ground.:<TAP>
\nBlood trickled from an injured knee.:<PAGE>
As passers-by began to turn and stare, the girl knew she could not leave the boy as he was.:<PAGE>
As she began tending to his wound, she asked him::<TAP>
\n"Where are your parents? Can I take you to them?":<TAP>
\n\nBut the boy's lowered head only shook back and forth slowly.:<TAP>
\n"I don't know where my father is," he said in a wavering voice.:<PAGE>
"All I know is that he's leaving soon for an important meeting.":<TAP>
\nThe boy's voice hitched on the edge of a sob.:<TAP>
\n\nAs it did so, a thought came to the girl.:<TAP>
\nPerhaps his father is the one I seek.:
\nIf the boy was the son of a politician, it would explain his fine dress.:<PAGE>
With this in mind, the girl cheerfully agreed to help him find his missing parent.:<PAGE>
His eyes glistening with tears, the boy handed her something in a wordless gesture of thanks.:<TAP>
\nIt was a small, scuffed figurine of a kind and dignified woman.:<TAP>
\n\nShe was the heroine of a fairy tale told and retold in the boy's native land.:<PAGE>
"She's you!" said the boy as he broke out into a smile.:<TAP>
\nBut the girl just looked away.:<TAP>
\n\nBecause she knew she did not help the boy out of kindness.:<PAGE>
The girl needed to locate the politician's ship as soon as possible.:<TAP>
\nGrasping the boy's hand, she began pulling him up the beach, hoping against hope he would see a familiar sight.:<PAGE>
Suddenly, his face brightened. "Father!" he cried as he slipped from her hand and began to run.:<TAP>
\nThe girl took off after him.:<PAGE>
Turning around, the father smiled as his son leapt into his waiting arms.:<TAP>
\n\n"There you are!" he said. "You almost made me miss my meeting.":<PAGE>
The father tilted his head to mutter a word of thanks to the girl, then began carrying his son onto the ship.:<TAP>
\n\nA sliver of a smile flickered across the girl's face before vanishing as quickly as it came.:<TAP>
\nAlmost as if it was never there at all.:<PAGE>
This was her ship.:<TAP>
\nAll that remained was to make her way aboard and learn what she could.:<TAP>
\n\nShe immediately began formulating her plan.:<PAGE>
But as her mind whirled, she noticed a woman moving silently into place behind her.:<PAGE>
The woman was familiar, for she came from the girl's own house.:<TAP>
\nShe had been sent to the port to monitor the girl and ensure the mission was a success.:<TAP>
\nBut they were never supposed to interact.:<PAGE>
Her appearance could only mean one thing: The situation had changed.:<TAP>
\nThe woman leaned down and whispered fiercely in the girl's ear::<TAP>
\n\n"He means to declare war. We must act. Leave none alive.":<PAGE>
The deck was slick.:<TAP>
\nThe corpses were still.:<TAP>
\nHer blade was red.:<PAGE>
In less time than it takes to draw a breath, the girl and her monitor had slaughtered every last person on the ship.:<PAGE>
The woman wiped the blood from her blade with a practiced hand and spared a glance at her charge.:<TAP>
\n"Ever seen this many bodies before?":<TAP>
\n\nThough the girl would not meet her gaze, she nodded slowly.:<TAP>
\n\n"Of course. Too many times to count.":<PAGE>
The woman chuckled. "Right, right. Forgot you're the boss's daughter.":<TAP>
\nThe girl sheathed her blade in silence.:<PAGE>
By chance, her eyes darted to the water, where she saw the figurine she had received slowly bobbing up and down.:<TAP>
\n\nHearing the boy's words in her mind, she dropped her eyes.:<PAGE>
He was right. She was exactly like the figure—a helpless thing being tossed about, an assassin forever at the mercy of the waves.:<PAGE>
Years have passed since that day.:<TAP>
\n\nThe woman shakes her head to clear her thoughts as a bell rings out announcing the arrival of a ship.:<TAP>
\nShe knows her targets are aboard.:<PAGE>
They are foreign politicians who scheme to infiltrate her homeland.:<TAP>
\nHer mission is to prevent that—by whatever means necessary.:<PAGE>
The woman stands some distance away and watches the passengers disembark.:<TAP>
\n\nOne particularly large man steps off clad in nothing but a loincloth. Must have been hot in there, thinks the woman idly.:
But the next person to step off brings a small shiver of delight.:<TAP>
\nIt is her target.:<PAGE>
Her lord's orders were clear::<TAP>
\nShe was to prevent the invasion of her homeland.:<TAP>
\nShe was to kill the target with all speed.:<TAP>
\n\nIt was the same reason she had stained another ship in crimson all those long years ago.:<PAGE>
The reason why she took the life of the young boy.:<TAP>
\nAnd the reason why she still remembers the figurine to this day.:<TAP>
\nThe one that was exactly like her.:<PAGE>
A haze of melancholy passes over her face as she looks out over the distant horizon.:<TAP>
\n\nI wonder where that thing drifted off to.:
But she shakes off her momentary fugue and begins walking after her target.:<TAP>
\nThe footprints she leaves in the sand are stolen away by the waves.:<PAGE>
Once, a small girl lived in a town far away.:<TAP>
\nHer family is poor, and though times are rough, she lives her life to its fullest as best she can.:<PAGE>
Her days are often spent playing alone in a ruin outside of town.:<TAP>
\n\nShe has no friends, so this run-down building is her only companion.:<PAGE>
Her days are ones of hardship.:<TAP>
\nBut today, she is filled with life and energy.:<TAP>
\n\nOr so she desperately wants to believe.:<TAP>
\nFor today is her birthday.:<PAGE>
But there is no delicious feast waiting for her.:<TAP>
\nNo presents.:<TAP>
\n\nAnd no one to celebrate her special day—not even her parents.:<PAGE>
So instead, she celebrates alone.:<TAP>
\n\n"Happy birthday!" she cries to herself, causing warmth to blossom in her chest.:<PAGE>
She spins in a circle, imagining herself as a beautiful ballerina.:<TAP>
\nShe sings. She dances. She tries all the fun things she can think to do.:<PAGE>
Because this is her birthday party.:<TAP>
A day to forget the pain of everyday life.:<TAP>
\nAnd more than anything else, she wants this day to be special.:<PAGE>
The lonely birthday party continues.:<TAP>
\n\nThe next event takes place on a craggy stone table.:<TAP>
\nThe girl begins forming something out of dirt and mud.:<PAGE>
It is a grand birthday cake—one far too big for a single person to consume.:<TAP>
\n\nIt seems impossible that someone so small can construct such a thing, let alone that she could build it at all.:<PAGE>
For her mother and father have never celebrated her birthday.:<TAP>
\nThough she had always wanted a party, she knew her parents were too destitute to do such a thing.:<PAGE>
And as a result, she has no idea what a real cake is supposed to look like.:<PAGE>
Or taste like.:<TAP>
\nOr smell like.:<TAP>
\nThe only thing she knows for certain is that they are delightful.:<PAGE>
<align=center>More than anything, she wants to share a cake with her family someday.:<PAGE>
And with that dream in mind, she continues to build her creation.:<PAGE>
Her dirt cake slowly takes shape.:<TAP>
\nThough it is a tad off-kilter, she finally completes it.:<TAP>
\n\nBut as she gazes at her creation, she notices something is missing.:<TAP>
\nShe needs to add something very, very important.:<PAGE>
And she knows exactly what it is::<TAP>
\nThe cake has no candles.:<TAP>
\n\nShe begins searching for branches that can act as a suitable substitute.:<PAGE>
She knows she needs as many straight little twigs as her age.:<TAP>
\n\nAfter a bit, she begins breaking off branches and whittling them down.:<TAP>
\nShe will not compromise on the candles.:<PAGE>
A cake only becomes grand with proper candles, after all.:<PAGE>
Suddenly, a sweet scent wafts over her.:<TAP>
\nIt is the most lovely thing she has ever smelled.:<PAGE>
Was someone baking treats nearby, maybe?:<TAP>
\nThe question lingers in her mind as she finishes collecting her sticks.:<PAGE>
But when she turns back to her cake, she is greeted by an unbelievable sight.:<TAP>
\nHer creation of dirt and mud has transformed into a real cake.:<PAGE>
The cake the girl worked so hard to make has somehow become real.:<PAGE>
White cream.:<TAP>
\nColorful fruit.:<TAP>
\n\nThe girl cannot hide her joy.:<TAP>
\nHer cheers of celebration quickly turn into song.:<PAGE>
The happiest birthday song ever sung fills the quiet of the ruin.:<PAGE>
And in the far-off shadows, something watches.:<TAP>
\n\nIt is a strange creature—neither human nor animal.:<PAGE>
It had been unable to turn away from the girl as she played, and could not help but interfere.:<TAP>
\nEven though such a thing is forbidden.:<PAGE>
"Just...":<TAP>
\n\n"Just for today.":<TAP>

The strange creature holds the warmest wishes for the girl.
And seeing her smiling face, it knows these wishes have come true.:<PAGE>
<space=13em>"Happy birthday, little one.":<TAP>
\n\n<space=13em>"Here's a present from Mama.":<PAGE>
